scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Catalina Gavril
scrape.text: I will be honest, I did not enjoy the book. Though, it really feels more like a play, than a novel. The major dilemma it poses to the readers is unrealistic. As a parent, I would also do anything for my child, but the characters seem to want to justify murder depending on the victim's likeability. The language is pretentious and the storyline gets caught into too many gaps that the author draws attention to, but does not fill. The main voice is that of an angry, violent man, whose actions are disregarded due to a disorder he suffers (?) from. However, kudos to the author's ability to remain true to his characters, as despicable as they may be...
